extracted-table.table-caption: Socio-demographic, symptoms, and imaging measures for the two control groups (orthopedic control, OC, and healthy controls, HC).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in (). Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). PSQI is the global PSQI score using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Questionnaire. RPQ is the total scores from the Rivermead Post Concussion Symptoms questionnaire. Total number of symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with *. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

caption.p: Socio-demographic, symptoms, and imaging measures for the two control groups (orthopedic control, OC, and healthy controls, HC).

table-wrap-foot.p: Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in (). Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). Total number of symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with *. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

extracted-table.table-caption: Socio-demographic, symptoms, and imaging measures for control and mTBI patients at two visits (14Day and 6–12Mon).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in (). Positive CT or MRI findings are based on admission CT and clinical MRI sequences. Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). PSQI is the global PSQI score using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Questionnaire. RPQ is the total scores from the Rivermead Post Concussion Symptoms questionnaire. Total number of symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with*. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

table-wrap-foot.p: Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in (). Positive CT or MRI findings are based on admission CT and clinical MRI sequences. Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). PSQI is the global PSQI score using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Questionnaire. RPQ is the total scores from the Rivermead Post Concussion Symptoms questionnaire. Total number of symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with*. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

extracted-table.table-caption: Sicio-demographic, symptoms, and imaging measures for mTBI patients with and without memory problems at two visits (14Day and 6–12Mon).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: The existence of memory problems was defined as RPQ ratings ≥ 2 at the 14Day visit. Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in ( ). Positive CT or MRI findings are based on admission CT and clinical MRI sequences. Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). PSQI is the global PSQI score using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Questionnaire. RPQ is the total scores from the Rivermead Post Concussion Symptoms questionnaire. Total Number of Symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥ 2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Same mTBI patients were included for both visits, therefore demographic information stays the same. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with *. BMI, Body Mass Index. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

caption.p: Sicio-demographic, symptoms, and imaging measures for mTBI patients with and without memory problems at two visits (14Day and 6–12Mon).

table-wrap-foot.p: The existence of memory problems was defined as RPQ ratings ≥ 2 at the 14Day visit. Values shown are Mean ± SD, with ranges or percentage in ( ). Positive CT or MRI findings are based on admission CT and clinical MRI sequences. Race includes White (W), Black or African American (B), Asian (A), and Other (O). PSQI is the global PSQI score using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Questionnaire. RPQ is the total scores from the Rivermead Post Concussion Symptoms questionnaire. Total Number of Symptoms was counted when reported as at least mild symptoms (RPQ ratings ≥ 2). WM-ePVS is the white matter ePVS burden. BG-PVS is the basal ganglia ePVS burden. Same mTBI patients were included for both visits, therefore demographic information stays the same. Significant p-values (p < 0.05) were shown in bold with *. BMI, Body Mass Index. MVC, Motor Vehicle Collision.

extracted-table.table-caption: Logistic regression model coefficients for Model 2 (Figure 7).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Among all socio-demographic and clinical information, Education and CT or MRI findings were selected to compose the best logistic model for prediction of 6–12Mon memory problem. 14Day WM-ePVS and ALPS were also significant factors (bolded with *).

caption.p: Logistic regression model coefficients for Model 2 (Figure 7).

table-wrap-foot.p: Among all socio-demographic and clinical information, Education and CT or MRI findings were selected to compose the best logistic model for prediction of 6–12Mon memory problem. 14Day WM-ePVS and ALPS were also significant factors (bolded with *).
